title: Invalid help message when traits in #[derive()] miss type annotation

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-invalid-suggestion
labels.description: A structured suggestion resulting in incorrect code

body:
```rust

#[derive(Serialize, Deserialize)]
struct Container<T: Serialize + Deserialize> {
	data: T
}

```

Which gives me this error message:

```
error[E0283]: type annotations needed
  --> src/main.rs:33:21
   |
33 | #[derive(Serialize, Deserialize)]
   |                     ^^^^^^^^^^^ cannot infer type for type parameter `T`
34 | struct Container<T: Serialize + Deserialize> {
   |                                 ----------- required by this bound in `Container`
   |
   = note: cannot satisfy `T: _::_serde::Deserialize<'static>`
   = note: this error originates in a derive macro (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)
help: consider specifying the type argument in the function call
   |
33 | #[derive(Serialize, Deserialize::<T>)]
```

Which suggests invalid modification.

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.47.0-nightly (09f4c9f50 2020-08-07)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 09f4c9f5082f78b0adcee83d3ab4337e000cd28e

```
